definition: to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription

sentences.english: Local colour lends [adds] peculiar interest to the novel.
sentences.chinese: 地方色彩给这部小说增加了兴味。

sentences.english: He created little boys, full of spirit and fun.
sentences.chinese: 祂创造了小男孩，让他浑身是劲和兴味。

sentences.english: Capturing such a beautiful moment can be exciting as well as a fun activity.
sentences.chinese: 捕捉到如此美丽的一刻既令人激动，又饶有兴味。
不幸的婚姻使我们兴味索然。
阿齐兹饶有兴味地注视着他。

sentences.english: I have used shampoo bed three transferred, the price is cheap, such as a sense of interest replies.
sentences.chinese: 我有二手洗头床三转让，价钱廉价，如感兴味回帖。

sentences.english: It is called "Jiaozi" in Chinese, it means meat their dumpling.
sentences.chinese: 这仪器中文名叫“饺子”，兴味是肉馅面食。

sentences.english: Art interesting, the spirit of social reform.
sentences.chinese: 艺术的兴味，改革社会的精神”。

sentences.english: The result is awaited with interest.
sentences.chinese: 人们饶有兴味地等待着结果。

sentences.english: Therefore the 13th Dalai Lama was interesting.
sentences.chinese: 因此，十三世达赖喇嘛是饶有兴味的。

sentences.english: They listened to the speaker with profound interest.
sentences.chinese: 他们怀着浓重的兴味倾听着演讲者。

sentences.english: They are silent very static, stand aloof from the worldly affairs, to everything all uninterested.
sentences.chinese: 他们沉默好静，与世无争，对任何事情均兴味索然。

sentences.english: I'll respond to your counter-offer by reducing our price by three dollars.
sentences.chinese: 你的价钱太高，买方没有兴味还盘。

sentences.english: He looked at me with some amusement.
Parties switched him on but they seemed to switch her off.
sentences.chinese: 社交聚会使他兴致勃勃，可她似乎兴味索然。

sentences.english: Slowly, with an air of amusement, he nodded.
sentences.chinese: 他慢慢地点头，一副饶有兴味的神态。

definition: to be rich in (some quality or other)
to tease/to poke fun at/to make fun of
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
